{"step_by_step_thinking": "The enlargement of the blind spot is not typically associated with primary open angle glaucoma, diabetic macular edema, or optic nerve hypoplasia. However, it is known to occur in papilledema, as mentioned in Document [3]. In papilledema, the optic disc swells due to increased intracranial pressure, which can lead to an enlarged blind spot.", "answer_choice": "D"}
